alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 3:31AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Central and southern Spartanburg county and most of Cherokee County, including the cities of Spartanburg, Gaffney and Blacksburg. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to drainages and streams, including parks, greenways and trails, golf courses, boat-access areas, farmland, and woodlands. Nuisance flooding of poor-drainage areas, including underpasses and intersections, is also expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen since Thursday morning. The rain has tapered off in the advisory area, but most rivers and streams are still rising due to runoff. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Some streams and associated tributaries may exceed bankfull conditions over the next few hours, including Lawsons Fork Creek and Fairforest Creek near Spartanburg, and the North, Middle, and South Tyger rivers near Roebuck, Reidville, Lyman, and Duncan, flooding adjacent low-lying areas with shallow inundation. Additionally, common flood- prone areas in the Spartanburg metro, including railroad underpasses, may experience ponding and brief closure. Lawsons Fork Creek near Lake Forest Drive is rising steadily and has exceeded the Action/Advisory Stage of 12 feet, as is approaching 14 feet. The creek should crest soon starting to recede early Friday morning. Nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying woodland areas is expected between US 221 and Goldmine Rd at these levels, as well as the Edwin Griffin Nature Preserve and The Country Club of Spartanburg. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spartanburg, Gaffney, Greer, Woodruff, Duncan, Lyman, Pacolet, Cowpens, Wellford, Blacksburg, Roebuck, Pacolet Mills, Reidville, Croft State Park, Cedar Springs, USC Upstate, Moore, GSP Airport, Kings Mountain State Park and Pauline. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
